businessInformationDescription: This information helps customers recognize your business, and may appear in your payment statements, invoices, and receipts.
uploadBusinessLogoDescription: Must be at least 200px by 200px and smaller than 1MB
thisInformationHelps: This information helps with identification so that others on your team are able to recognize you easily.
thisLanguageAffects: This language affects how you view your dashboard.
requiredFormat: Required. Please enter a correct {{value}} format
pinInfo: Required to send batch disbursements and refund credit card charges
pinsNotMatch: The PIN you’ve entered does not match. Please input the correct PIN
currentPasswordError: Current password is not allowed to be empty
USER_LOCKED_ERROR: Your account is locked, please check your email inbox and spam folder for the details on how to unlock
newPasswordError: Password must contain at least one letter, one number, and 8 characters minimum
mfaInfo: Require a security key in addition to your password
contactFor2FA: Please contact <2>help@xendit.co</2> to change your 2FA settings
greatIdea2StepVerif: Great Idea! 2-Step Verification helps secure your account in the event of any unauthorized access or access attempts. After you complete this quick setup, a code will be required to login from a new location or change your account settings.
toBeginSetup2StepVerif: To begin the setup, please make sure you are using a laptop for the first step, and have your phone ready for the second step.
confirmThisOtp: Confirm this is you by entering a one-time code that was just sent to the email associated with this account.
enterOtp: Enter the code sent to your email:
INVALIDATE_OTP_ERROR: Failed to find and invalidate {{type}} status
VALIDATE_OTP_ERROR: Failed to find and validate {{type}} status
follow2StepVerifInstruction: Please follow the instructions below to set up 2FA
openApp: Open the app and follow the instructions to scan this QR code.
otpEmptyError: OTP is not allowed to be empty
cantUseBarcode: Can’t scan the QR code? Enter this text code manually.
AUTH_TOKEN_NOT_VALID: The code entered does not match, please try again.
USER_NOT_FOUND_ERROR: We were unable to retrieve data for this user
invalidPhone: Please provide a valid phone number
disableMFASubtitle: Doing this means you won't be asked for a code from your authenticator app anymore.
disableMFASuccessSubtitle: Two-step verification has now been disabled. You will no longer require a code from authenticator app for authorization
enterYourPassword: Enter your password to authenticate the change
MAXIMUM_OTP_ERROR: You have reach the maximum limit for new {{type}} request. Please try again in an hour.
pinSetSuccess: Your 6-digit PIN has been successfully set
UNSUPPORTED_IMAGE_FILE_TYPE_ERROR: The image format is not supported. Please use JPG or PNG instead
IMAGE_FILE_SIZE_LIMIT_ERROR: The image size is too large. Please use images less than 1MB
backupCodeDescription: Backup codes are used in case you lose access to your device. For security reasons, each code can only be used once.
backupCodeInfoPanel: <1>Important!</1> Print or copy your backup codes and keep them somewhere safe but accessible. Treat them the same way as you would to your password.
chooseSecurityDesc: 2-Factor Authentication helps secure your account in the event of any unauthorized access or access attempts.
authenticatorDesc: Use an app on your phone to generate authentication codes.
smsOTPDesc: We’ll send a code via text message to generate authentication codes.
onceYouHaveScan: Once you have scanned the barcode, enter the 6-digit authentication code generated by the authenticator app.
phoneNumberInvalid: Please enter a valid phone number.
registerYourPhone: Register your phone number to add greater security to your account.
justSentSms: We just sent you an SMS
justSentEmail: We just sent you an Email
yourPhoneUpdated: Your phone number has been updated and verified.
byUpdatingPhone: By updating this phone number, your current 2-Factors Authentication will be disabled. You can re-enable through settings page.
